channel.title: Pablo Ortega Tong
channel.description: Recent content on Pablo Ortega Tong

item.title: Cu-ISR Part 1 - Intro
item.description: One of the main reasons for starting to write posts on this website was to prepare for my viva or PhD defense. As you may not know, my PhD focused on the reactive transport and geochemistry of in-situ recovery of copper, also known as Cu-ISR. I find Cu-ISR and ISR in general quite fascinating. One of the biggest challenges of this technology, especially for Cu and other metals, is the lack of predictive reactive transport models that can accurately forecast recovery and financial success while ensuring minimal environmental disturbance.

item.title: About me
item.description: Hey there! ðŸ‘‹ I’m Pablo, originally from Chile but now enjoying life in the beautiful country of Aus (Perth - mind the gap). I’m a computational geoscientist with a solid nine years of experience in consulting, specializing in hydrogeochemistry. Currently, I’m just about to wrap up my PhD in geochemistry and reactive transport modeling at the University of Western Australia in Perth. I’m a huge fan of simulating, predicting, and quantifying how contaminants move around in groundwater.
